ECSchema.description: Custom attributes to indicate BIS concepts.

ECEnumeration.description: Used with SchemaInfo to declare the schema author's intended compatibility with BIS rules and patterns for the schema.

ECEnumerator.name: A
ECEnumerator.description: True BIS schemas carefully designed for editing and interoperability.

ECEnumerator.name: B
ECEnumerator.description: Either: Legacy “consensus” schemas intelligently converted to BIS, or new BIS schemas, with one-way conversion to BIS in mind, but not intended for editing (native format).

ECEnumerator.name: C
ECEnumerator.description: Legacy schema with software-discoverable semantics, intelligently converted to follow applicable BIS rules and patterns.

ECEnumerator.name: D
ECEnumerator.description: Legacy schema with minimim or no software-discoverable semantics, converted to follow basic BIS rules and patterns.

ECEnumeration.description: Used with SchemaInfo to declare the schema author's intended layer for the schema.

ECEnumerator.name: Core
ECEnumerator.description: Schemas defining the 'fabric of the universe' and some key organizational strategies.

ECEnumerator.name: Common
ECEnumerator.description: Schemas defining abstract concepts and patterns used by multiple disciplines.

ECEnumerator.name: DisciplinePhysical
ECEnumerator.description: Schemas defining physical/spatial and closely associated concepts, in light of a specific discipline.

ECEnumerator.name: DisciplineOther
ECEnumerator.description: Schemas defining concepts from modeling perspectives other than physical, in light of a specific discipline.

ECEnumerator.name: Application
ECEnumerator.description: Schemas defining concepts that no other schema would need or want to reference. Product and iModel Connector schemas as well as dynamically-generated or user-customized schemas belong to this layer.

ECCustomAttributeClass.description: Declares the intended grade and layer of this schema.

ECProperty.description: Indicates the compatibility of this schema in light of BIS rules and patterns.
Indicates the layer in the BIS schema hierarchy that this schema targets.
